titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ruth Bracher Papers
titlestmt.author: Emily DiLeo

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 00:01

did.abstract: Ruth Bracher was an alumna of the Yale School of Music. Her collection contains correspondence, clippings and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, clippings and photographs, as well as a copy of the book, Horatio Parker, by George W. Chadwick (Yale University Press, 1921). The correspondence relates to Yale University Secretary's office and Horatio Parker (Yale School of Music). Also included are two brief letters from Nadia Boulanger. The collection contains a handful of clippings related to Yale, Bruce Simonds, Horatio Parker and Nadia Boulanger, as well as a disassembled album of photographs. Of particular interest are two photographs of Nadia Boulanger, and three photographs of General John J. Pershing with Yale President Arthur Twining Hadley at Yale University commencement in 1920.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ruth Bracher earned the B.A. from Western College for Women in 1918, the B.M. from the Yale School of Music (where she studied piano with Bruce Simonds) in 1921, and the M.M from the College of Music of Cincinnati in 1932. She also studied with Nadia Boulanger. She taught music at Western College for Women (in Oxford, Ohio) from 1921 until her retirement in 1959.
